remarks: Associative law for the biconditional, for decidable propositions. The classical version (without the decidability conditions) is an axiom of system DS in Vladimir Lifschitz, "On calculational proofs", Annals of Pure and Applied Logic, 113:207-224, 2002, ~ http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users/ai-lab/pub-view.php?PubID=26805 , and, interestingly, was not included in _Principia Mathematica_ but was apparently first noted by Jan Lukasiewicz circa 1923.  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 4-May-2018.)
statement: biassdc $p |- ( DECID ph -> ( DECID ps -> ( DECID ch -> ( ( ( ph <-> ps ) <-> ch ) <-> ( ph <-> ( ps <-> ch ) ) ) ) ) ) $.
